summary: This document is a chain of emails from October 2020 between FBI agents and a federal prosecutor coordinating the logistics for Ghislaine Maxwell to review sensitive discovery materials at the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC). It details scheduling changes, personnel assignments, and strict instructions that FBI agents are not to speak with Maxwell as she is represented by counsel.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the discovery review; she is to review sensitive discovery materials at the MDC while represented by her attorney.

connections.description: N., an FBI agent, is part of the team facilitating Maxwell's review of discovery materials, under strict orders not to speak with her.
S., an FBI agent, is assigned to assist with the logistics of Maxwell's discovery review at the detention center.

events.title: Maxwell Discovery Review Session
events.description: A scheduled meeting for Ghislaine Maxwell to review sensitive discovery materials at the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC) from 8am to 3pm, with her attorney present and FBI agents facilitating.

events.title: Cancelled Meeting
events.description: A previously scheduled meeting for Maxwell's discovery review was cancelled by her attorney, necessitating rescheduling.

locations: 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007 (Southern District of New York)
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was reviewing sensitive discovery materials in October 2020 while in custody at the Metropolitan Detention Center.
FBI agents were instructed not to speak with Maxwell during these reviews because she was represented by counsel.
Logistics for the review were coordinated between the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York and the FBI's New York Field Office.
The review sessions required a secure laptop and coordination with the MDC Captain for logistics.
